com.jfoenix.controls

Class JFXRippler

  • java.lang.Object
    • javafx.scene.Node
      • javafx.scene.Parent
        • javafx.scene.layout.Region
          • javafx.scene.layout.Pane
            • javafx.scene.layout.StackPane
              • com.jfoenix.controls.JFXRippler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    javafx.css.Styleable, javafx.event.EventTarget

    @DefaultProperty(value="control")
public class JFXRippler
extends javafx.scene.layout.StackPane
    JFXRippler is the material design implementation of a ripple effect. the ripple effect can be applied to any node in the scene. JFXRippler is a StackPane container that holds a specified node (control node) and a ripple generator. UPDATE NOTES: - fireEventProgrammatically(Event) method has been removed as the ripple controller is the control itself, so you can trigger manual ripple by firing mouse event on the control instead of JFXRippler
    Since:
    2016-03-09

      indicates whether the ripple effect is infront of or behind the node
      javafx.css.StyleableBooleanProperty ripplerDisabled
      the ripple disable, by default it's false.
      javafx.css.StyleableObjectProperty<javafx.scene.paint.Paint> ripplerFill
      the default color of the ripple effect
      javafx.css.StyleableObjectProperty<java.lang.Number> ripplerRadius
      the ripple radius size, by default it will be automatically computed.
      javafx.css.StyleableObjectProperty<java.lang.Boolean> ripplerRecenter
      the ripple recenter property, by default it's false.

    • Property Detail

      • ripplerRecenter

        public javafx.css.StyleableObjectProperty<java.lang.Boolean> ripplerRecenterProperty
        the ripple recenter property, by default it's false. if true the ripple effect will show gravitational pull to the center of its control
        See Also:
        setRipplerRecenter(Boolean)

      • ripplerRadius

        public javafx.css.StyleableObjectProperty<java.lang.Number> ripplerRadiusProperty
        the ripple radius size, by default it will be automatically computed.
        See Also:
        getRipplerRadius(), setRipplerRadius(Number)

      • ripplerFill

        public javafx.css.StyleableObjectProperty<javafx.scene.paint.Paint> ripplerFillProperty
        the default color of the ripple effect
        See Also:
        getRipplerFill(), setRipplerFill(Paint)

      • maskType

        public javafx.css.StyleableObjectProperty<JFXRippler.RipplerMask> maskTypeProperty
        mask property used for clipping the rippler. can be either CIRCLE/RECT
        See Also:
        getMaskType(), setMaskType(RipplerMask)

      • ripplerDisabled

        public javafx.css.StyleableBooleanProperty ripplerDisabledProperty
        the ripple disable, by default it's false. if true the ripple effect will be hidden
        See Also:
        isRipplerDisabled(), setRipplerDisabled(Boolean)

      • position

        public javafx.beans.property.ObjectProperty<JFXRippler.RipplerPos> positionProperty
        indicates whether the ripple effect is infront of or behind the node
        See Also:

                  JFXRippler.RipplerPos pos)
        creates a rippler for the specified control
        Parameters:
        control -
        pos - can be either FRONT/BACK (position the ripple effect infront of or behind the control)

      • JFXRippler

        public JFXRippler(javafx.scene.Node control,
                  JFXRippler.RipplerMask mask)
        creates a rippler for the specified control and apply the specified mask to it
        Parameters:
        control -
        mask - can be either rectangle/cricle

      • JFXRippler

        public JFXRippler(javafx.scene.Node control,
                  JFXRippler.RipplerMask mask,
                  JFXRippler.RipplerPos pos)
        creates a rippler for the specified control, mask and position.
        Parameters:
        control -
        mask - can be either rectangle/cricle
        pos - can be either FRONT/BACK (position the ripple effect infront of or behind the control)
